dt: {bc}to make into or as if into an island
{bc}to dot with or as if with {a_link|islands}

shortdef: to make into or as if into an island
to dot with or as if with islands

dt: {bc}a tract of land surrounded by water and smaller than a continent
{bc}something resembling an island especially in its isolated or surrounded position: such as
{bc}a usually raised area within a thoroughfare, parking lot, or driveway used especially to separate or direct traffic
{bc}a superstructure on the deck of a ship (such as an aircraft carrier)
{bc}a kitchen counter that is approachable from all sides

et: alteration (influenced by Anglo-French {it}isle{/it}) of earlier {it}iland{/it}, from Middle English, from Old English {it}īgland{/it} (akin to Old Norse {it}eyland{/it}), from {it}īg{/it} island (akin to Old English {it}ēa{/it} river, Latin {it}aqua{/it} water) + {it}land{/it} land
shortdef: a tract of land surrounded by water and smaller than a continent
something resembling an island especially in its isolated or surrounded position: such as
a usually raised area within a thoroughfare, parking lot, or driveway used especially to separate or direct traffic

dt: islands of Papua New Guinea in the western Pacific north of New Guinea in the Bismarck Archipelago {it}area{/it} 800 square miles (2080 square kilometers), {it}population{/it} 30,160

shortdef: islands of Papua New Guinea in the western Pacific north of New Guinea in the Bismarck Archipelago area 800 square miles (2080 square kilometers), population 30,160

dt: islands in the Aegean Sea including the Cyclades and the Northern and Southern Sporades

shortdef: islands in the Aegean Sea including the Cyclades and the Northern and Southern Sporades

shortdef: islands of southwestern Alaska extending in an arc 1700 miles (2735 kilometers) southwest and west from Alaska Peninsula to a point beyond the 180th meridian

shortdef: islands in the western Indian Ocean southwest of Seychelles; a dependency of Seychelles
